intro: Planchonella puulupensis, commonly known as the Kauaʻi hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Kauaʻi. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a smooth, glossy surface. Planchonella puulupensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators and habitat for various wildlife species.
